TopicTitle: Can't Find TAC Life Support Extra Parts

Articles.Content:
Hey all,

Back in .23 there was a set of containers for TAC Life Support that were basically either retextured/resized goo canisters or the large radial mounted RCS canisters. I liked that they looked stock, but for the life of me I can't find them anymore now that I'm updating to 24.2! Can anyone point me in the right direction?

The Resources would be wrong on them and you could just make your own by editting the radialRCSTank or RCStankRadialLong is what, I think he used if you need help, I will edit them if you can tell me how much Resources would fit in them.

EDIT- And here are some nice parts 2 not to far from stock look put again there for tac 9 http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/85147-TAC-containers-by-R-R-Dynamics-Inc

and theres this http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75129-Universal-Storage-0-8-2-%28For-KSP-0-24-2%29-6th-September-2014

EDIT- And this http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/70986-0-23-Cargo-Transfer-Bags-and-Tanks%28for-TAC-life-support%29-0-7 and some small ones http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/70986-0-23-Cargo-Transfer-Bags-and-Tanks%28for-TAC-life-support%29-0-7?p=1358257&viewfull=1#post1358257

Edited September 7, 2014 by Mecripp2

After a few more hours digging, I found them, it was Somnambulic Aerospace parts. It was about aesthetics. The skins were different than stock parts, which was what I liked, but still looked stockish. You're right though, they are no longer balanced although they still work. R.R.'s looked nice, but they weren't updated nor was the tweakscale it was packaged with, and they'd need balancing too. I also have universal storage installed now that he finally put out the tac stuff

After a few more hours digging, I found them, it was Somnambulic Aerospace parts. It was about aesthetics. The skins were different than stock parts, which was what I liked, but still looked stockish. You're right though, they are no longer balanced although they still work.

Yeah it's on my to-do list. Rebalance and replace the multiple sizes with TweakScale.
